    • Method Detail

      • dataType

        public StandardKeyMaker dataType(Class<?> clazz)
        Description copied from interface: KeyMaker
        Configures the data type for this type. This only applies to property keys.

        Property instances for this key will only accept attribute values that are instances of this class. Every property key must have its data type configured. Setting the data type to Object.class allows any type of attribute but comes at the expense of longer serialization because class information is stored with the attribute value.

        Specified by:
        dataType in interface KeyMaker
        Parameters:
        clazz - Data type to be configured.
        Returns:
        this type maker
        See Also:
        TitanKey.getDataType()

      • list

        public KeyMaker list()
        Description copied from interface: KeyMaker
        Configures this key to allow multiple properties of this key per vertex. For instance, the property key "phoneNumber" is typically a list()-enabled key to be able to store multiple phone numbers per individual.

        If a key is configured to be list-valued, the properties must be added with TitanVertex.addProperty(TitanKey, Object), retrieved via TitanVertex.getProperties(TitanKey) and individually deleted.
        Specified by:
        list in interface KeyMaker
        Returns:
        this KeyMaker

      • single

        public KeyMaker single(TypeMaker.UniquenessConsistency consistency)
        Description copied from interface: KeyMaker
        Configures this key to allow at most one property of this key per vertex. In other words, the key uniquely maps onto a value for a particular vertex. For instance, the key "birthdate" is unique for each person.

        Use TitanElement.setProperty(TitanKey, Object) to set or replace this property.

        This consistency constraint is enforced by the database at runtime. The consistency parameter specifies how this constraint is ensured.
        Specified by:
        single in interface KeyMaker
        Returns:

      • single

        public KeyMaker single()
        Description copied from interface: KeyMaker
        As KeyMaker.single(com.thinkaurelius.titan.core.TypeMaker.UniquenessConsistency) with the default consistency UniquenessConsistency#LOCK
        Specified by:
        single in interface KeyMaker
        Returns:

      • unique

        public KeyMaker unique(TypeMaker.UniquenessConsistency consistency)
        Description copied from interface: KeyMaker
        Configures this key such that its values are uniquely associated with at most one vertex across the entire graph. For instance, the key "socialSecurityNumber" is a unique key since each SSN belongs to at most one person vertex.

        This consistency constraint is enforced by the database at runtime. The consistency parameter specifies how this constraint is ensured.
        Specified by:
        unique in interface KeyMaker
        Returns:

      • unique

        public KeyMaker unique()
        Description copied from interface: KeyMaker
        As KeyMaker.unique(com.thinkaurelius.titan.core.TypeMaker.UniquenessConsistency) with the default consistency UniquenessConsistency#LOCK
        Specified by:
        unique in interface KeyMaker
        Returns:

      • indexed

        public StandardKeyMaker indexed(Class<? extends com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Element> clazz)
        Description copied from interface: KeyMaker
        Configures instances of this type to be indexed for the specified Element type using the standard Titan index. One can either index vertices or edges.

        This only applies to property keys. By default, the type is not indexed.

        Specified by:
        indexed in interface KeyMaker
        Returns:
        this type maker
        See Also:
        TitanKey.hasIndex(String, Class)

      • indexed

        public StandardKeyMaker indexed(String indexName,
                       Class<? extends com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Element> clazz,
                       Parameter... paras)
        Description copied from interface: KeyMaker
        Configures instances of this type to be indexed for the specified Element type using the external index with the given name. This index must be configured prior to startup. One can either index vertices or edges.

        By default, the type is not indexed.

        Optionally, one can provide parameters that are passed on to the indexing backend to configure how exactly this key should be indexed. Which paramters are accepted depends on the storage backend that is configured for the given indexName.

        Specified by:
        indexed in interface KeyMaker
        Returns:
        this type maker
        See Also:
        TitanKey.hasIndex(String, Class)
